description.value:
Whenever you finish a Long Rest, choose one type of land: Arid, Polar, Temperate, or Tropical. Consult the table below that corresponds to the chosen type; you have the spells listed for your Druid level and lower prepared.

Additionally, you gain the following benefit based on your Primal Order:

Magician. You can cast Druid spells as though you were in the space of a plant you created with a spell such as @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplEntangle00]{Entangle} or @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplGraspingVi]{Grasping Vine}, but you must use your own sense.

Warden. You can move plants via your Living Greenery as a Magic action or Bonus Action.

Arid Land
Druid LevelCircle Spells
3@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplBlur000000]{Blur}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplBurningHan]{Burning Hands}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplFireBolt00]{Fire Bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke,} @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplInvisibili]{Invisibility}
5@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplFireball00]{Fireball}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplHaste00000]{Haste}
7@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplBlight0000]{Blight}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplHallucinat]{Hallucinatory Terrain}
9@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplSeeming000]{Seeming}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplWallOfSton]{Wall of Stone}
